Note: Participant notices that neural band takes a couple of tries to register hand gestures
Participant notes that they are able to discern details like patterns on a fabric much easier when screen is positioned in front of a dark solid background
Participant decides that watching content on MR display would appear more clear in a darker setting
Participant looking down toward dark table to see screen more clearly
Participant notes that videos are less clear while sitting in bright green chair near drawer set given brighter lighting overhead
Participant notices that colors appear faded on MR display
Participant feels that position of screen within MR glasses is too low for long term comfort as they are often looking down and neck might feel strained after some time
Volume randomly increased to loudest setting
Participant continuously having to adjust glasses as they slip off constantly and says they feel heavy on nose bridge
Participant notices discomfort in wrist as neural band must be snug enough to register hand gestures but says arm feels irritated
Participant suggests a ring similar to the Aura Ring as an example of a comfortable wearable device
Participant notices a rainbowing effect from peripheral vision
